III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
This facility is currently operating as a satellite location of Bethany Christian
Services, Grand Rapids, child placing agency (license # CB410200976). The facility
is located in a modern, single story office complex on a main street in East Lansing.
There are other businesses located within this office building. The office is located
on a bus route and is easily accessible from both local streets and the highway. The
office has a large waiting area, a reception/office area, two meeting areas to
accommodate parent/child visitation, and sufficient office space for current
employees. Client files will be kept in locked filing cabinets; there is adequate file
storage space in the facility. The facility has a room which can be used to conduct
foster parent training sessions. If the program grows beyond capacity of the current
office setting, a larger suite is available in the same office building (same address)
and will be leased.
B. Program Description
Chief Administrator Nancy Willemin stated Bethany Christian Services is seeking a
child placing agency for this facility in order to expand services offered to children
and families in the Lansing, Michigan area. Bethany Christian Services, Lansing, will
now be authorized to certify foster homes for licensure, receive children for
placement in licensed foster homes, supervise independent living placements,
evaluate applicants for adoption, and place/supervise children with adoptive parents.
Nancy Willemin said she plans to recruit foster homes and continuously build foster
care capacity up to 100 cases within the next several years. The current staff
members have adequate experience, educational background, and training to
provide services as requested in the application.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
Bethany Christian Services’ child placing agency will use all relevant policies and
procedures from Bethany’s Grand Rapids child placing agency (license
#CB410200976); these policies and procedures were reviewed and approved by the
2

Bureau of Children and Adult Licensing during the last renewal licensing study
completed September 22, 2010.
This consultant reviewed all current employee files. All employee files were complete
and no rule or statutory violations were found.
The agency is in substantial compliance with all relevant licensing and statutory
requirements.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
This consultant recommends the issuance of a child placing agency license, private.
